Sentencas: Cobalt was doped into the Ce-doped SrMnO3 system to enhance the low ionic conductivity of Ce-doped SrMnO3 (SCM) for solid oxide fuel cell cathode application.
Titulo: Structural analysis and electrochemical properties of cobalt-doped Sr0.9Ce0.1MnO3-δ cathode for IT-SOFCs

Sentencas: Structural and conductivity changes as a function of the Co content were investigated.
Titulo: Structural analysis and electrochemical properties of cobalt-doped Sr0.9Ce0.1MnO3-δ cathode for IT-SOFCs

Sentencas: Sr0.9Ce0.1Mn1-xCoxO3-delta (SCMCo, x = 0.1, 0.2, 0.3) cathode materials were synthesized by an EDTA citrate complexing process, which yielded a single perovskite structure, and the lattice volume was expanded by substituting Ce and Co ions.
Titulo: Structural analysis and electrochemical properties of cobalt-doped Sr0.9Ce0.1MnO3-δ cathode for IT-SOFCs

Sentencas: The increased lattice volume was attributed to a decrease in the valence state of the manganese and cobalt and an increase in the oxygen vacancy concentration.
Titulo: Structural analysis and electrochemical properties of cobalt-doped Sr0.9Ce0.1MnO3-δ cathode for IT-SOFCs

Sentencas: An increase in the concentration of oxygen vacancies with increasing Co content was identified by thermogravimetric analysis.
Titulo: Structural analysis and electrochemical properties of cobalt-doped Sr0.9Ce0.1MnO3-δ cathode for IT-SOFCs

Sentencas: The electrical conductivity decreased with increasing Co content, which was attributed to an increase in the activation energy for polaron hopping.
Titulo: Structural analysis and electrochemical properties of cobalt-doped Sr0.9Ce0.1MnO3-δ cathode for IT-SOFCs

Sentencas: Although the electrical conductivity was decreased by cobalt-doping, the polarization resistance of SCMCo also decreased significantly (from 5.611 to 1.171 Omega cm(2) at 800 degrees C).
Titulo: Structural analysis and electrochemical properties of cobalt-doped Sr0.9Ce0.1MnO3-δ cathode for IT-SOFCs

Sentencas: The decreased polarization resistance is attributed to enhanced oxygen-ion transfer kinetics with cobalt-doping.
Titulo: Structural analysis and electrochemical properties of cobalt-doped Sr0.9Ce0.1MnO3-δ cathode for IT-SOFCs

Sentencas: We conclude that cobalt substitution leads to enhancement in the electrochemical properties of the cathode due to an increase in oxygen vacancy concentration.
Titulo: Structural analysis and electrochemical properties of cobalt-doped Sr0.9Ce0.1MnO3-δ cathode for IT-SOFCs
